title: Construction of the Great Pyramid of Giza
description: Built as a tomb for the Pharaoh Khufu during Egypt's Fourth Dynasty, the Great Pyramid is the oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.

title: Magna Carta is sealed
description: King John of England affixed his seal to the Magna Carta at Runnymede, establishing principles that limited royal authority and influenced constitutional law.

title: Johannes Gutenberg invents the printing press
description: Gutenberg's movable-type printing press revolutionized the spread of information, literacy, and ideas across Europe.

title: Christopher Columbus reaches the Americas
description: Columbus's first voyage across the Atlantic led to sustained European contact with the Americas.

title: Martin Luther posts the Ninety-five Theses
description: Luther's theses criticized certain practices of the Catholic Church and catalyzed the Protestant Reformation.

title: Declaration of Independence
description: The Thirteen Colonies declared independence from Great Britain, forming the United States of America.

title: French Revolution begins
description: The French Revolution dramatically transformed French society and politics, influencing modern democratic movements.

title: First powered flight
description: The Wright brothers achieved the first controlled, sustained flight of a powered, heavier-than-air aircraft at Kitty Hawk.

title: First Moon landing (Apollo 11)
description: Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin became the first humans to walk on the Moon, marking a milestone in space exploration.

title: Fall of the Berlin Wall
description: The opening of the border between East and West Berlin symbolized the end of the Cold War and led to German reunification.

title: The World Wide Web becomes publicly available
description: Tim Berners-Lee opened the World Wide Web to the public, enabling the modern internet as we know it.

title: Human Genome Project completed
description: An international research effort successfully mapped and sequenced the human genome, transforming biology and medicine.
